documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances. Users cannot automatically transfer unused ticket allowances between policy years, which limits flexibility in time-off management.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Admins configuring air ticket policies must manually calculate total requests across multi-year cycles (e.g., 5 requests/year × 5 years = 25 total requests). No automatic carry-over of unused balances between years.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For multi-year policies requiring X requests per year over Y years, set total number of requests to X × Y. Example: 5 requests/year for 5-year cycle = set total to 25 requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration — Multi-Year Cycles and Request Allocation

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently cannot notify or tag line managers about ticket processing when they are outside the standard approval flow. There is no automated notification system for proxy requesters or managers raising requests for employees.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers who submit air ticket requests on behalf of blue collar employees cannot receive notifications or track completion status unless they are part of the formal approval workflow. Creates communication gaps and reduces visibility.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Include line managers in the approval flow to enable notifications, or use email/manual communication as interim solution for status updates.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Request Notifications — Tracking Proxy Requests and Line Manager Visibility

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions. There are specific scenarios where employees cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot manage air ticket requests when: auto-encashment policy is inactive, hire date/probation end date is missing, employee is not yet eligible for encashment, or employee is in a non-auto-encashment policy. Creates confusion about eligibility and status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure employee records are complete (hire date, probation end date) and employee is assigned to active auto-encashment policy before attempting to manage air ticket requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Auto-Encashment — Policy Eligibility and Employee Record Requirements

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to limit data visibility. The platform does not provide configurable options to restrict cross-module access or segment viewable financial information by category.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Expense Managers can view all employee loans and air tickets, not just work expenses. Organizations cannot restrict sensitive financial data visibility by role, creating potential data privacy and security concerns.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently no granular permission controls available. Organizations must accept broad Expense Manager visibility or avoid assigning this role to users who should not see loans/air tickets.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Role-Based Access Control — Expense Manager Permissions and Data Visibility Scope

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat platform does not support a flexible document approval workflow that allows post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users cannot download letter requests, stamp them externally, and re-upload signed documents. Approved requests cannot be modified, attachments cannot be added to approved requests, and approved requests cannot be returned to pending status. Limits external document signing workflows.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Complete all document modifications before approval. Use email to share stamped documents with employees rather than uploading to system. Consider alternative document management processes outside Bayzat.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Request Workflow — External Stamping and Document Re-Upload Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks the capability to delete or reverse processed air ticket expense entries after they have been finalized. This prevents users from cleaning up test or erroneous data once an expense has been processed.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Once air tickets are processed, they cannot be deleted through the UI. Test data, dummy entries, and erroneous expenses become permanent records. Users must be extremely careful during initial entry as no cleanup mechanism exists.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Avoid processing test or dummy air tickets. Verify all air ticket entries before processing. Contact support for backend-level deletion if critical errors occur.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Expense Management — Processed Expense Deletion and Reversal Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks full role-based group restrictions, with grouping functionality limited to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups across HR and document modules.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employee grouping restrictions only apply to finance and payroll modules. People Manager role grouping only restricts Air Tickets module, not Documents, Departments, or employee work tabs. Adjustment Manager role can view all adjustments across groups. HR modules are not restricted by employee groups.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Use employee groups for finance and payroll access control only. For HR module restrictions, implement alternative access control measures or limit People Manager role assignment to trusted users.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions — Module-Specific Grouping Support and Limitations

excluded.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
excluded.reason: Ticket documents a feature on product roadmap (Employee Grouping and Structures) that is partially implemented for some modules but not yet available for HR modules. While this has documentation value, the ticket is primarily a feature request tracking item with no current testable behavior or user-facing limitation to document. The feature is acknowledged as in-progress by platform team with no committed timeline.
